H0.text: Exposure to hot weather is the most likely cause of the cough, fever, and sore throat that several students complained of feeling sick with over a two‑week period.

H1.text: Decrease in physical exercise is the most likely cause of the cough, fever, and sore throat experienced by several students over a two‑week period.

H2.text: Consumption of bad food is the most likely cause of the students' cough, fever, and sore throat that developed over a two‑week period.

H3.text: Infection by a virus is the most likely cause of the cough, fever, and sore throat that several students reported over a two‑week period.

A4.text: Influenza, commonly known as the flu, is an infectious disease caused by influenza viruses.

A5.text: Symptoms range from mild to severe and often include fever, runny nose, sore throat, muscle pain, headache, coughing, and fatigue.
